skill.name: competitor-analysis
skill.description: Analyze competitor website structures, messaging patterns, and unique features. Use when researching competition, identifying gaps, or informing content strategy.
skill.summary: Analyze competitor website structures, messaging patterns, and unique features. Use when researching...
skill.author: CleanExpo

security_audit.summary: Markdown-only skill defining a research framework. No executable code, network calls, or file system access beyond standard documentation. Pure prompt-based skill for competitor website analysis.

content.user_title: Analyze competitor websites for strategic gaps
content.value_statement: Manually researching competitor websites takes hours and often misses key insights. This skill provides a structured framework to systematically analyze competitor page structures, messaging patterns, trust signals, and unique features to identify gaps and opportunities.
actual_capabilities: Extract headlines, value propositions, and messaging patterns
Identify trust signals, CTAs, and conversion elements
Rank competitors by market authority and reach
Document unique features and interactive elements
Generate gap analysis with prioritized recommendations
limitations: Requires manual input of competitor URLs to analyze
Does not perform automated data collection or scraping
Analysis quality depends on thoroughness of page examination
No access to competitor internal data or analytics

use_cases.title: Pre-redesign research
use_cases.description: Analyze competitor websites before website redesign to identify industry standards and opportunities for differentiation.

use_cases.title: Messaging gap identification
use_cases.description: Identify what competitors are saying that your brand is not, informing content strategy and messaging framework development.

use_cases.title: Quarterly competitive review
use_cases.description: Conduct regular competitive analysis to track changes in competitor positioning, pricing, and feature releases.

prompt_templates.title: Quick competitor scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the competitor-analysis skill to analyze [competitor website URL]. Focus on the homepage, services page, and pricing page. Extract their main value propositions, trust signals, and call-to-action patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-competitor comparison
prompt_templates.scenario: Compare multiple competitors side by side
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these three competitors: [URL 1], [URL 2], [URL 3]. For each, document their section structure, headlines, unique features, and trust signals. Then create a comparison table highlighting key differences.

prompt_templates.title: Gap analysis report
prompt_templates.prompt: Use competitor-analysis to examine [competitor URLs]. Compare their features, messaging, and trust signals against our offering. Document what they have that we do not and recommend priority improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Industry benchmark report
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the competitive landscape for [industry/niche]. Identify national leaders, regional tops, and emerging players. For the top 3 competitors, provide detailed page-by-page analysis including section order, headlines, CTAs, and unique features.

Trust signals: 4.9 stars (2,400+ reviews), SOC 2 certified, 500+ enterprise clients

CTAs: 'Start Free Trial' (header), 'Book a Demo' (mid-page), 'Contact Sales' (footer)
Gap: Missing comparison page and customer case study highlights

best_practices: Analyze at least 3 competitors before drawing conclusions about market standards
Focus on why competitor approaches work, not just what they do
Document analysis dates since websites change frequently
Prioritize gaps by potential business impact rather than volume
anti_patterns: Copying competitor messaging directly instead of learning from patterns
Analyzing only obvious competitors and missing emerging threats
Failing to note what's missing from competitor sites as well as what exists
Skipping the About and Blog pages which often reveal brand strategy

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It uses browser tools to navigate competitor sites and extract insights.

faq.question: How many competitors should I analyze?
faq.answer: Analyze at least 3-5 competitors including national leaders and emerging players for a comprehensive view.

faq.question: Can this skill scrape competitor data automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides a framework for structured analysis but requires you to manually input competitor URLs and examine pages.

faq.question: Is my research data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: The skill references a competitor_analysis table for storage. Check your workspace configuration for data retention policies.

faq.question: Why am I seeing different results than expected?
faq.answer: Ensure competitor websites are fully loaded before analysis. Some sites require interaction to reveal all content. Retry with browser navigation.

faq.question: How is this different from web search tools?
faq.answer: Web search finds information. This skill provides a framework for structured analysis of actual competitor websites including layout, messaging, and features.
